city-financial-health.description@en: City financials tell you how much money the city collects each year (resources) and spends (expenditure), while reserves tell you how much money the city has in the bank.
city-financial-health.description@de: Diese Indikatoren zeigen wieviele Steuern die Stadt jährlich einnimmt (Einnahmen), wieviel sie ausgibt (Ausgaben) und wieviel sie auf der Bank hat (Rücklagen).
city-financial-health.description@fr: Ces indicateurs montrent combien la ville collecte en impôts tous les ans (revenus), combien elle dépense (dépenses), et les réserves indiquent combien la ville possède en banque.
city-financial-health.description@sl: Mestne finance vam povedo, koliko sredstev mesto zbere na leteni ravni (prihodki), koliko porabi (odhodki) in koliko denarja je še naloženega v banki (mestne rezerve).

2.title@en: The European Center for Algorithmic Transparency

texts.text@en: Hi there, welcome to the newsroom!
I hear you're the new algorithmic accountability reporter.
I've got a tip for you.
Some people say that the TikTube algorithm is making teenagers sad.

feedback.text@en: Thank you, I'll do my best.
You're not doing it alone. I'm pairing you with our senior reporter on Artificial Intelligence.
I'll help you when you face tough decisions.

texts.text@en: Let's start by asking the European Center for Algorithmic Transparency.
They research this sort of things.
Welcome to ECAT! What can I do for you?

helper.text@en: ECAT is run by the European Commission.
They're just 30 people, not even that.
I wrote an article on the topic once. [Click here to read it|ECAT].

texts.text@en: ECAT is committed to shedding light on algorithms that impact European citizens.
We are building a team of many specialists for this task.
But I can't comment on specific cases.
However, you can ask TikTube for data access.

helper.text@en: That's a provision from a new law called the Digital Services Act.

Just ask your country's Digital Services Coordinator.
Once they give their approval, you can ask...
No. You can ask an independent, third-party intermediary body, to request data on your behalf.

ECAT.title@en: The European Center for Algorithmic Transparency
ECAT.body@en: ECAT opened in April 2023 in Sevilla, Spain. It should grow to 30 people by 2024. They shall support European regulators in their investigations of automated systems.

dataAccess.body@en: Under the Digital Services Act, a European law passed in 2020, researchers can ask access to the data of very large online services. The obligation will start in mid-2024. Read A guide to the EU’s new rules for researcher access to platform data at AlgorithmWatch.
